      • BASE_64

        public static final java.lang.String BASE_64
        The characters for Base64 encoding.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • base64

        public static final java.lang.String base64(byte[] buf)
        Base-64 encode a byte array, returning the returning string.

        Note that this method exists merely to be compatible with the challenge-response authentication method of rsyncd. It is not technincally a Base-64 encoder.

        Parameters:
        buf - The byte array to encode.
        Returns:
        buf encoded in Base64.

      • writeASCII

        public static void writeASCII(java.io.OutputStream out,
                              java.lang.String ascii)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Write a String as a sequece of ASCII bytes.
        Parameters:
        out - The OutputStream to write to.
        ascii - The ASCII string to write.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If writing fails.

      • readLine

        public static java.lang.String readLine(java.io.InputStream in)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Read up to a '\n' or '\r', and return the resulting string. The input is assumed to be ISO-8859-1.
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from.
        Returns:
        The line read, without the line terminator.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • toHexString

        public static java.lang.String toHexString(byte[] b)
        Convert a byte array to a big-endian ordered hexadecimal string.
        Parameters:
        b - The bytes to convert.
        Returns:
        A hexadecimal representation to b.

      • toHexString

                                           int off,
                                           int len)
        Convert a byte array to a big-endian ordered hexadecimal string.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • take

        public static <T> com.google.common.base.Optional<T> take(java.util.Map map,
                                                          java.lang.String key,
                                                          java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Fetch a value from a Map, returning a present Optional value if present in the map and if that value is of the given type (or a subclass). Otherwise, return an absent value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The value type.
        Parameters:
        map - The map to query.
        key - The key to look up.
        type - The expected type of the value, if present.
        Returns:
        The value from the map, or an absent value if not present or of a different type.

        public static double toMillis(long nanos)
